page.title: 09The Whitehouse:Ivy Farm.
page.content: The {Whitehouse},built approx 300 years years ago used to be 2 separate houses the walls were {wattle} and daub and the roof was lower than it is now and was {thatched}.Recently the house was modernised,the roof was raised and {tiled} and the two houses were rebuilt to form one house.The house use to belong to the {Duke of Lancaster} (the Queen)it was bought in 1966 by the present owners. {Ivy Farm} was knocked down,and rebuilt about eight years ago and now supplies farm equipment.The farms in the area are mostly {dairy} and {beef}.Cows grased on unsown and unfertilised grassland. The farms are fairly big(approx.40 acres).Not many machines are used,only for milking and transporting hay in winter.The {Saddle Inn} and {Sitting Goose} are 2 nearby public houses.
